fields.headline: 'It's great Britain has caught up'
fields.bodyText: Mark Bolland, former PR adviser to the Prince of Wales It's fantastic that gay people have the freedom and opportunities available elsewhere in Europe. I'm from Canada, which has been ahead of the curve for some time. It's great that Britain has caught up. James Fenton, poet and author It is one of the abiding achievements of the Labour government - disgraceful though it is in other respects. Angela Mason, director of the Women and Equality Unit Civil partnerships are a very good thing. I've been involved in the campaign for a long time. You wondered whether it would make a difference; the answer is yes. What's been heartening is the welcome from the rest of society. Mark Ravenhill, playwright People don't realise that there has been this issue about property and inheritance and that if your partner dies their families can dispute the will. A lot of people feel that they won't really have equality until they can use the word marriage. Alan Duncan, Conservative MP I think the act makes good sense and strikes the right balance between the existing rights and responsibilities of families and the religious institutions. All the financial arrangements seem sensible too, and I welcome it. Professor Celia Kizinger, sociologist I could not have imagined 30 years ago, as I came out as a lesbian, that this would be possible. It's a huge advance. But South Africa ruled for same-sex marriages ... we should celebrate greater equality but this [in the UK] is hardly cutting edge.
